turns.text: Yep. Yeah. Most of them do, yeah.

turns.speaker: me
turns.text: Okay, so this would. This could be a world in which, like. If they're one thing that would be helpful for me before the next conversation we have, if there's, like, a list of, like, five or six or even 10 of these, like, companies where, like, these would be, like, the key integrations that we would want to do. I could get a sense of, like, okay, these ones we do have, these ones we could build with an API integrations, and these ones, like, we wouldn't be able to do for whatever reason. And that can, I think, help you guys FlowBuilder a more informed decision as well.

turns.speaker: them
turns.text: Yep, that sounds great.

turns.speaker: me
turns.text: Okay? I guess so. In terms of I realize you guys are just starting evaluating. When would you want to start a two week trial? Because, like, I guess that's like an important question of, like, when would your team have capacity to actually try some of these implementations? Because we wouldn't want you to, like, start a two week trial and you're like, oh, actually, you know, we were busy. We had other stuff going on, so we just, like, didn't get a chance to use it.

turns.speaker: them
turns.text: Personally, I think. Except for the fact that, you know, Monday is a holiday. I want to give a two week trial, but I would rather start earlier rather than later. That's my thinking.

turns.speaker: me
turns.text: So. Yeah. Look, for the sake of argument, let's say. Let's assume you start the trial next week. Do you guys want to. Could we say the 29th, like the 20eigth or 29th for us to have a follow up conversation, assuming that gives you enough time to have some of those initial discussions. And then we could have a broader discussion around, like, okay, what is the art of the possible? Here. What? Working? What's not working? I'll send something. This same window on the 28th. If that works for you guys. Okay? That sounds good. I'll send that over. I James send over the rubric information that I mentioned. And then also, Lavania, you'd asked about the, like, training, learning resources. I'll send that stuff as well.

turns.speaker: them
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: me
turns.text: And then, of course, as you're going through the trial, just, like, let me know. Happy to, like, sort of be a resource, answer questions for you guys. But you James also have full access to, like, our normal supports and all that stuff as well if you. If you need it, but I don't want you to. Feel like you can't reach out to me is my main point. So, yeah, if you have other questions in the meantime, let me know. We James chat again in about a week and a half, and I hope you guys have a great weekend.

turns.speaker: them
turns.text: Okay? Thank you. Thank you for your time. Thanks.

turns.speaker: me
turns.text: Bye.

activityLog.description: , 2026**: Initial discovery call with Lavanya (PM) and Eric (technical). Explored use case: ingesting data from 500 installer partners with diverse systems. Showed AutomateFlow copilot and workspace features. They have IntegrateHub for different use case. Agreed on 2-week trial starting next week, follow-up call Jan 28. ACTION: Send comparison rubric, learning resources, and check on solar tool integrations (Aurora, Helioscope).

doc_greenmarket-exchange_xpansiv-discove.title: GreenMarket Exchange-discovery-followup
doc_greenmarket-exchange_xpansiv-discove.content:
Subject: AutomateFlow Trial Setup + Resources | GreenMarket Exchange Follow-up



Hi Lavanya and Eric,



Great connecting today. Here are the resources I promised:



Trial Setup

Start your 2-week trial here: AutomateFlow Sign Up

Add your team members from Settings  Team. Everyone gets full access during the trial.



Learning Resources

 AutomateFlow Academy (start here)

 Community Forum for questions

 Custom Actions Docs for API integrations



AutomateFlow vs IntegrateHub Comparison

Here's the evaluation rubric I mentioned - covers the key trade-offs for your use case.



Initial ROI Analysis

I put together a draft ROI tracker based on our conversation - 10 use cases, ~240 hrs/month potential savings. Let me know if the estimates feel directionally right.



Integration Check

I checked on the solar design tools you mentioned:

Aurora Solar  No native integration, but has API (can connect via custom actions)

Helioscope  Same situation, API available

If you can share the list of your top 5-10 partner systems, I'll run a full compatibility check before our next call.



Next Steps

You: Start trial, try building one integration (Google Sheets  your API is a good quick win)

You: Send me the list of top partner systems to check

Jan 28: Reconnect to review progress and validate ROI assumptions



Questions in the meantime  just reply here.



Talk soon,

Alex

doc_greenmarket-exchange_xpansiv-roi-tra.title: GreenMarket Exchange-roi-tracker
doc_greenmarket-exchange_xpansiv-roi-tra.content: Use Case | Department | Description | Difficulty | Est. Time Saved (hrs/month) | Est. Time Value ($/year) | Est. Error/Risk Reduction ($/year) | Status | Notes | Webhook/API Data Intake | IT/Product | Partners with APIs push data to AutomateFlow webhook endpoint - auto-validates and routes to internal system | Custom API | Phase 1 - Trial | Top 50 partners drive 80% of volume. Priority targets for API integration. Currently manual spreadsheet uploads. | Google Drive/Sheets Monitoring | Operations | Auto-detect when partners upload spreadsheets to shared folders, extract and standardize data | Medium | Phase 1 - Trial | Many partners send Excel/Sheets. Could set up shared folder per partner with auto-processing. | Email Attachment Processing | Operations | Parse incoming emails with data attachments, extract structured data, route to intake system | Medium | Phase 2 | Fallback for partners who can't do API or Drive. Gmail/Outlook parsing + document extraction. | Data Standardization Engine | Product | Transform diverse input formats into unified schema for internal system - field mapping, validation, normalization | Complex | Phase 1 - Trial | Core value. Each partner has different field names, formats. AutomateFlow Tables could serve as transformation layer. | Internal System Sync | IT | Push standardized data to GreenMarket Exchange's internal API/database - creating customer records and applications | Custom API | Phase 1 - Trial | Final step in pipeline. Custom action to hit their internal API. | Aurora Solar Integration | Product | Direct API connection to Aurora Solar design platform - pull project data automatically | Custom API | Phase 2 - Q1 | No native integration. Has API. Would need custom action build. High-value if many partners use Aurora. | Helioscope Integration | Product | Direct API connection to Helioscope design platform - pull project data automatically | Custom API | Phase 2 - Q1 | No native integration. Has API. Same approach as Aurora. | CRM Source Integrations | Product | Connect to common CRMs used by installers (SalesCloud, CRMPlatform, etc.) to pull customer data | Medium | Phase 2 - Q1 | Some partners manage data in CRM. AutomateFlow has native connectors for major CRMs. | Partner Onboarding Automation | Operations | Automated setup flow for new partners - create folders, configure zaps, send credentials | Medium | Phase 3 - Q2 | Reduce partner onboarding time. Self-service setup where possible. | Data Quality Alerting | Operations | Monitor for failed integrations, data validation errors, missing fields - alert team and partner | Medium | Phase 3 - Q2 | Proactive error handling vs current reactive approach. TeamChat/email alerts. | SUMMARY | Total Use Cases Identified: | Total Est. Hours Saved/Month: | Total Est. Time Value/Year: | Total Est. Error/Risk Reduction/Year: | TOTAL ESTIMATED VALUE/YEAR: | CALCULATION METHODOLOGY | Time Value = Hours Saved/Month × 12 months × $50/hr labor cost (tech/operations blended rate) | Error/Risk Reduction = Estimated value of partner churn prevented, application delays avoided, compliance risk | KEY ASSUMPTIONS FROM DISCOVERY CALL (Jan 16, 2026): | • ~500 installer partners total, top 50 drive 80% of data volume | • Partners use diverse systems: Aurora, Helioscope, CRMs, custom apps, spreadsheets | • Current state: Partners must hire staff to convert data formats for GreenMarket Exchange | • Competitive pressure: Making partners' lives easier = competitive differentiation | • IntegrateHub exists but used for different use case (internal app → accounting) | • Revenue model: Fee-based on solar REC transactions - faster data = faster revenue | ⚠️ CONSERVATIVE ESTIMATES: Does NOT include: partner acquisition/retention value, | DIFFICULTY LEGEND | Simple | Standard integrations, 1-2 hours to build | Medium | Multi-step workflows, conditional logic, 2-8 hours | Complex | Multiple systems, custom logic/testing, 1-2 days | Custom API | Requires webhooks/code - AutomateFlow handles this, may need SA support | PROPOSED TIMELINE | Jan 20-31: Trial period - build initial webhook + sheets + standardization flows | Jan 28: Check-in call - review trial progress, troubleshoot, discuss expansion | Feb: Evaluate enterprise partnership based on trial results | Q1: Phase 2 - Solar design tool integrations (Aurora, Helioscope) | Q2: Phase 3 - Partner onboarding automation, quality alerting | 40 | 30 | 25 | 50 | 20 | 15 | 15 | 20 | 10 | 15
